pre_flight_fixes: Run grep before deleting. Output of investigation: only codex.html references these files — the old pre-monolith build being replaced in C-011. No live monolith page touches them. Deletion is safe.

specs.title: Remove orphaned pre-monolith assets
specs.description: Delete assets/css/main.css and assets/js/main.js. These are leftover from the pre-monolith build and are only referenced by the old codex.html, which is being fully replaced in C-011. No current live page (index.html, virtue-audit.html, fortress-protocol.html) references either file.

files.details: Run: grep -r 'main.css' soleinvictvs-web/ — confirm only codex.html references it, then delete. Do NOT delete if any unexpected reference is found — stop and report instead.
Run: grep -r 'main.js' soleinvictvs-web/ — confirm only codex.html references it, then delete. Do NOT delete if any unexpected reference is found — stop and report instead.

specs.acceptance_criteria: assets/css/main.css and assets/js/main.js no longer exist on disk. The assets/ directory has no remaining files (the fonts/ subdirectory does not exist yet — that is correct). Grep across all HTML files confirms zero remaining references to either deleted file from any non-codex page.
edge_cases: If grep finds an unexpected reference in a non-codex file, stop and report — do not delete.
If either file has already been deleted by a previous commit, note it and skip — spec is already satisfied.

The old codex.html will briefly have broken references after this commit. This is acceptable because C-011 replaces codex.html entirely. Vitalik should not push C-009 to main in isolation — it ships with the C-011 PR.

issues_to_raise.title: [DECISION] build — C-009 and C-011 must ship in the same PR
issues_to_raise.body: C-009 deletes main.css and main.js, which are referenced by the old codex.html. The old codex.html is replaced in C-011. Between C-009 and C-011, the old codex.html has broken references. To prevent a transient broken state on the live site, C-009 and C-011 must be included in the same feature branch and merged to main in a single PR. This is an architectural sequencing constraint, not a bug.

build_sequence_summary: 1. Grep to confirm zero non-codex references → 2. Delete assets/css/main.css → 3. Delete assets/js/main.js → 4. Commit. Branch stays open until C-011 is also complete.
risks_and_notes: The only risk is the transient broken state of old codex.html between C-009 and C-011. Mitigated by requiring both blueprints to merge together. No other pages are affected. No assets/fonts/ directory is created here — that is the operator's responsibility when font files arrive.
message_to_operator: C-009 is a one-shot delete. No code to review. The only constraint: do not merge this PR to main without C-011 (codex.html replacement) in the same PR.
message_to_vitalik:
BUILD ORDER:
1. Grep both files across all HTML — confirm only old codex.html references them.
2. Delete assets/css/main.css
3. Delete assets/js/main.js
4. Commit: chore(assets): remove pre-monolith orphaned css and js

WATCH OUT FOR:
- Do not push this commit to main without C-011 (new codex.html) in the same PR. The old codex.html will have broken references in the window between C-009 and C-011.
- Do not delete any other files — spec is exactly two files.

DO NOT:
- Delete assets/ directory itself — it needs to exist for future font assets.
- Proceed with deletion if grep finds unexpected references outside codex.html.

DONE WHEN:
- Both files are gone from disk.
- Grep across all HTML files confirms zero references to main.css or main.js from any page that isn't being replaced.
